channel.title: Interacively --pass-io to Whonix Template when using costom script to update.
channel.description:
When updating Qubes-Whonix TemplateVMs from dom0 using a custom script. Is it possible (or even advisable) to `interactively` interact when prompted with something like.
``` Configuration file '/etc/machine-id' ==> File on system created by you or by a script. ==> File also in package provided by package maintainer. What would you like to do about it ? Your options are: Y or I : install the package maintainer's version N or O : keep your currently-installed version D : show the differences between the versions Z : start a shell to examine the situation The default action is to keep your current version. *** machine-id (Y/I/N/O/D/Z) [default=N] ? ```
Obviously its not a good idea to put `-y` (yes to all) when updating.

## SYNOPSIS
`apt-get-noninteractive` [option]s

## Description
Simple wrapper that sets environment variables and adds --yes,
-o Dpkg::Options::=--force-confnew then forwards all arguments to apt-get.
Does not pass --force-yes.

If you like to keep old configuration files, add the following parameter.

-o Dpkg::Options::=--force-confold

Whonix/usability-misc/blob/master/usr/bin/apt-get-noninteractive

#!/bin/bash

## Copyright (C) 2012 - 2018 ENCRYPTED SUPPORT LP <adrelanos@riseup.net>
## See the file COPYING for copying conditions.

set -e

[ -n "$POLICYRCD" ] || POLICYRCD="/usr/share/usability-misc/policy-rc.d"
[ -n "$DEBIAN_FRONTEND" ] || DEBIAN_FRONTEND="noninteractive"
[ -n "$DEBIAN_PRIORITY" ] || DEBIAN_PRIORITY="critical"
[ -n "$DEBCONF_NOWARNINGS" ] || DEBCONF_NOWARNINGS="yes"
[ -n "$APT_LISTCHANGES_FRONTEND" ] || APT_LISTCHANGES_FRONTEND="text"
export POLICYRCD DEBIAN_FRONTEND DEBIAN_PRIORITY DEBCONF_NOWARNINGS APT_LISTCHANGES_FRONTEND

apt-get -o Dpkg::Options::=--force-confnew "$@"
